intro: Yuyba maguirei, commonly known as the Maguire's yuyba, is a rare flowering plant native to the Andean region of South America. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its finely divided, feathery leaves. The plant produces small, white to pale yellow flowers arranged in umbels, typical of its family. It thrives in high-altitude environments and is adapted to cool, moist conditions. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a vulnerable species.
